Reviews.Title: “bellachasse: ma chambre de bonne”
Reviews.Author: djmkzurich
Reviews.Content: If you want to get the feeling of staying in a cozy chambre de bonne in Paris: this is the place. Very bohemian. No shower... but a bath inside the room..., Lacroix everywhere. Very warm. The hotel though clearly saw its best time and possibly will need some restauration. Service not always superattentive, but at the end i was happy. Breakfast good and plentiful. I 'll come come back

Reviews.Title: “Mould in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Darsik
Reviews.Content: Very good location near Musee d'Orsay and Saint Germain boulevard, nice design, comfortable bed, but there was some mould in the bathroom and shower curtain. Disgusting and inadmissible for 4 stars hotel. We paid 150 euro per night and were disapointed. Not recommended!

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: paul_at_maisonMK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January for 3 nights. It is just what a boutique hotel should be - cool design, friendly, flexible, and like a home. Our room was pretty big considering it was in Paris. Dark & moody...great for a romantic weekend. And the location is superb - middle of St Germain, 2 mins from the metro, 1 min from Musée D'Orsay & the Seine. Thanks for a lovely stay - will definitely be back soon. Paul & Aoibheann

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: javitxu_8
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Ms & Mrs Smith. It didn't disappoint at all. I read the reviews here and I was expecting a tiny room. To be very straightforward, it is not big but good enough for a weekend getaway. The room is well designed and you don't feel overwhelmed by the space. It is good enough. I suppose Europeans and used to the size. Americans would expect something bigger. Staff: always helpful. They arrange the taxis and restaurant reservations for us. Outstanding. Breakfast: we told them to bring it to our room and it was delicious. Fast and quick. Bed: very comfortable. Bathroom: good enough for a couple of days. In our room, the toilet and shower were separated. It was fine, it isn't a hassle in my opinion. Shower worked well; products are standard. The room was really nicely decorated. We both like art, design and fashion and we were gladly surprised with the interiors. As for the location, it is unbeatable. Within walking distance to the metro station and Le Louvre. 5 min away from St Germain's main shops. We didn't spend much time in the room as Paris has enough things to keep you busy. If you don't book in advance the hotel can be quite pricy, so I am not sure if it would be worth (Value/money). If you do book in advance and pay no more than 180 GBP - 200 GBP, I believe it is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyShoreGuys
Reviews.Content: Caught a last-minute special on Jetsetter and was not disappointed at all! The hotel is fun and funky and if you've ever stayed in a boutique hotel in any major city you know what to expect in terms of size, but compared to some others we've stayed in, the room was laid out quite nicely and never felt crowded. The staff was incredibly friendly and always willing to offer assistance or advice. And the location just can't be beaten -- you can, literally, walk anywhere you want to go from here! Now I'm just wondering how I can get Christian Lacroix to make me some wall coverings like in the room -- talk about fun! Hotel le Bellechasse is definitely worth a stay!

Reviews.Title: “Position position position.....”
Reviews.Author: KimCL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this boutique hotel for 4 nights. This really hip hotel is well situated just a few steps from the Musee de Orsay, the Banks of the Seine and the beautiful gardens( can walk across to get to right bank). There are two Metro stations in close vicinity to the hotel, so once you have mastered the subway maps- it is really easy to get around. The hotel itself is small, compact and cozy . Rooms have been decorated by Christian Lacroix and are individually very interesting,modern and trendy but bit small.The lighting is not great, so bit difficult to read a book at night. We had one breakfast which was really good. There are plenty of cafes and restuarants in the area, so you never have to venture too far to find a snack or a good meal. I would definately recommend this hotel- and would return on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lacroix means haute design, Paris means small room”
Reviews.Author: MissMalik
Reviews.Content: Spent Valentines day weekend here. Was mostly compelled to stay due to two factors: 1) the location and 2) the design by Lacroix. I work in fashion, and am in general quite aesthetically-sensitive, so on this front the Bellechasse certainly did not disappoint! High design quality aside, the rooms are remarkably tiny, and for our room in particular the windows were not the typical Parisian height of some of the other rooms, but were rather small. Nonetheless, overall the stay was fantastic. One concierge was always remarkably helpful at arranging for dinner reservations on probably one of the most difficult weekends to do so in Paris. (He even could advise on how to get into Le Chateaubriand for dinner, despite them not taking reservations!) While the other concierge actually seemed quite lazy. Reception was generally friendly and helpful. Would recommend to those who bask in high design.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: s3jwang
Reviews.Content: Cute boutique hotel with a great location, short walk to the Orsay and very close to metro station. Rooms and lobby are very artistically done by Christian Lacroix. As with most hotel rooms in Paris, the rooms are quite tiny by American standards but this shouldn't really bother you since Paris is IMO the loveliest city in the world and if you're there you probably shouldn't be spending any significant time in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully tiny & 5-star location”
Reviews.Author: NandoPereira
Reviews.Content: The wallpapers are so amazing and the location so great that all I can do is to recommend (and go back to) this modern petit parisien hotel. The breakfast is charming too, and all kind of intimate because there aren't too many rooms nor large spaces around. You have the river on one side, right at the corner of the D'Orsay, and the Boulevard of Saint Germain on the other side. The room is really small but I enjoyed, a lot.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of Everything”
Reviews.Author: clevelandblonde
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here in the summer, and we both thought the hotel was charming. Hotels in Paris are expensive, and especially in the hottest neighborhoods, and this was no exception. The rooms were lovely and the location can't be beat! My only advice is NOT to ask the concierge for restaurant advice - we were sent to a very expensive and not very good place. Make your reservations before you go!

Reviews.Title: “Look around this is very average”
Reviews.Author: AjmMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Very disapointed in our stay here This hotel is looking tired inside and is in need of a revamp Bathroom fitout is inadequate and rally surprised how this can get a 4 star rating in current condition Only thing going for this place is its location Suggest look around elsewhere , have stayed in far better hotels in Paris for much better rate

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Lacroix Paris experience”
Reviews.Author: Tiggytigertiger
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite a find by my partner and I was excited to see it with it having been designed or furnished by Christian Lacroix. The decor did not disappoint - wonderfully colourful and patterned throughout the hotel, including all aspects of the room. I cannot personally compare the size of rooms in Paris as this was my first visit, however based on research, I'd suggest these were pretty good value. The hotel was very handy for walking around the city, or jumping on a velib bike, or heading across the road to the Musee d'Orsay. The reception staff were very helpful and as soon as they realised we did not speak french, they spoke in english to us and made us feel very welcome. The enthusiastic "bonjour" whenever we entered the reception area was just wonderful. I will stay there again on my next trip to Paris and definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...”
Reviews.Author: Erin A
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms for four nights and enjoyed every moment. Funky decor, delightful staff, clean, great location with metro and RER nearby. One room was quite large, the other perfectly adequate. We would definitely choose to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Groovy little place”
Reviews.Author: erasmus45z
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, for a quick weekend away with some friends. This hotel is small and the rooms are tiny, but that's what you get with a boutique hotel. We didn't mind, had we stayed longer we probably would have gone for a larger hotel. The rooms were fun and the beds very comfortable. But most importantly of all, it was quiet. So we had a lovely sleep. The staff are friendly and welcoming. Added to that, it is in a fantastic location. The most wonderful Musee D'Orsay is just around the corner and the fabulous cafes of Saint Germain just a few blocks away. We didn't have breakfast at Bellechasse, so can't comment on that. But for location, something a little different and a good night's sleep this place is fab!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: runway
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night but wish it could have been longer. The property is elegant, the rooms are on the larger size by Paris standards and the bathrooms are fabulous with tub and separate shower. The decorating was imaginative. We had a small courtyard outside our room. We were originally in another hotel but they did not have room for us on our last night so we moved here. It was great, I wish we had stayed here longer. One drawback, no family rooms here. Right by a metro and the Musee d'Orsay, a great neighborhood and only two blocks from the river if you like to go for a run.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay, everything perfect.”
Reviews.Author: pinkgardenias
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms, clean, friendly and helpful service. Location was perfect and close to a metro too. Great value, especially in Paris! Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianeRoanoke
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our three nights at Le Bellechasse. The staff were very friendly and assisted us with all of our requests ranging from transportation to dining. The rooms are small but comfortable with fun decor - each different and eclectic. There is a lovely breakfast room and a cute bar in the lobby. It is juat one block from the Musee d'Orsay and the metro (tho the stop was closed for reconstruction during our stay).

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: colinstacktroost
Reviews.Content: Inspiring interiors brought to life by noted designer Christian Lacroix make this fabulously located hotel a great "home base" for your stay in Paris. The rooms may be small, but they are beautifully styled, comfortable, and unique. You'll be perfectly positioned to experience all the sights of the city on foot, no metro or taxi necessary. American travelers used to the large rooms of a Howard Johnson or Holiday Inn will be in for a shock when they see the size of the living space that is customary for Paris, but should keep in mind that the treasures of this city are discovered outside of your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: LivePaola
Reviews.Content: The pros: Good location, interesting decor. Very quiet rooms if you look out on the inner courtyard. The cons: Rooms are small. Very small. I thought that by booking a Privilege room (the highest available) we would have a decent-sized room. We ended up in 101, where the bed was so close to the windows that I had to squeeze past the pillar between the two windows in order to get to my size of the bed. The creative bathroom layout is interesting but impractical. After our first night, our room wasn't made up when we returned to the hotel around 3:45 pm - I would have expected the room to be serviced in the morning. We waited in the bar area until the room was ready, but even there we had an unpleasant vacuum cleaner soundtrack, apparently because the reception and bar area were being cleaned in the afternoon too. In summary, as much as I liked the decor, I would not recommend this hotel for more than one night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect bijou hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: alrevs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in October 2011. The location - being almost literally right next door to the Musee D'Orsay was perfect - both for business and pleasure. Rooms are small - aren't they all in Paris - but are wonderfully quirky. Slight downside in mine was the lack of a proper shower but otherwise a perfectly functional room for sleeping. It was also very quiet at night which is always a relief in any major city. Breakfast was excellent (although I think it might be expensive) - lots to choose from and a relxed start to the day in the funky basement area. Final good point is the staff - who were very friendly and helpful - not least in serving us a drink after midnight when the bar was officially closed (although quite why the guy had to keep walking downstairs to the basement every time ice was required was beyond me). Bottom line - I'd have no trouble recommdning this place as somewhere great to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at le Bellechasse, Paris”
Reviews.Author: 7Cycle
Reviews.Content: We're frequent visitors to Paris, and recently spent a long weekend at le Bellechasse. The hotel is small, and exceptionally located in the 7th arrondissement, next to the Musee d'Orsay. I would not recomend this area at the height of the tourist season, but it's excellent at other times of the year. The hotel was designed by Christian Lacroix, so its decor is beautiful. However, the rooms are small. We were first given an "Original" room, which is in the middle of the three room categories available. While the room was small and charming, it lacked a proper shower. We felt that was unreasonable, given the hotel's four star rating and prices, and requested a different room. We ended up in a small, and fairly ordinary room in the "Discovery" category. The hotel staff were friendly, but not overly attentive or helpful. Overall, an enjoyable experience, but we would probably choose a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “nice but disappointing compared to the website”
Reviews.Author: Amel B
Reviews.Content: Let's start by the positive: The hotel is very good located : nice district, 50 m from Museum of Orsay and the RER station. 10mn from St-Germain des Pres. Very quite. BUT the rooms are very very small and the so called "by Christian Lacroix decoration" seems to allow the staff of the hotel to save on the maintenance: bath tube's tap was droping and towel-rail was broken. I mentioned it immediately to the staff, who didn't react at all before we left!!! We also dislike that the bathroom was not realy a room but a corner in the bed-room. This new fashion can work in a larger room, but not here: absolutely no space to put his toiletries! We didn't take our Breakfast at the hotel because it was served in an underground room, without any natural light. Terrible to wake up!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: 20bing20
Reviews.Content: A perfect location less than a half block from the Seine, right next to the Musee d'Orsay (and the Musee d'Orsay subway stop), and right across the river from the Jardin des Tuileries. My husband and I loved walking the city - this hotel was ideally located to do just that. Our room was small (by an American's standards), without a view, but very modern and impressively well-designed by Christian Lacroix. A key criteria for me is always the bathroom - again, very clean and modern. The "shower" is a hand-held nozzle (pretty standard for European hotels). The TV channel selection was minimal, but who goes to Paris to watch TV in their hotel room? The woman at the front desk was very friendly and helpful, and spoke excellent English. When we arrived, we got upgraded to a deluxe room. If your hotel standard is The Four Seasons, this hotel isn't for you. But it's a great boutique hotel in a perfect location that is reasonably priced. I wish I could add half-circles to the overall ratings: this would be a 4.5 of 5.0.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, soft mattresses but not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: DTMW
Reviews.Content: The Bellechasse is a member of SLHW and is one of the AA's handful of luxury hotels in Paris, alongside Le Crillon. It is difficult to understand why. The location could not be better for those who prefer le rive gauche. It is a few steps from the Musee d'Orsee. Additionally it has very comfortable, though not large, beds. Finally the staff were quite pleasant. Anyone booking should understand quite how small it is though. We booked a Privilege room, the largest available, but were amazed how small it and the hotel itself actually were. The room was on the top floor and so was in the eaves. The available space was much smaller than the footprint would suggest because the eaves meant that one could not walk all over the room. In fact about one third of the room was only of use for suitcases. Could not even sit in a chair. The wall paper was fabulous but the TV was on a wall bracket which extended 9 inches into the room. Doesn't sound much but given the overall dimensions we kept bumping into it when walking round the bed. The public spaces were equally small. There is only one unisex toilet serving the bar and breakfast room and we found each morning the corridor from our room to the lift - one metre wide - was blocked by the maid's trolley and laundry bags. The service was not bad insofar as the staff were polite. It was though non existent - no porter to take bags to or from the room, no evening turn down service and poor local knowledge - even to the extent of not knowing of quite a renowned restaurant 2 streets away.

Reviews.Title: “A satisfying experience at St Germain”
Reviews.Author: Robert E
Reviews.Content: An excellent location near Le Pont Neuf, the staff's attitude was caring. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs!”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: Hotel le Bellechasse certainly lived up to our expectations. Our room was very comfortable, the hotel's facilities were first-rate and its location was really convenient for everything we wanted to see and do in and around Paris - including Musée d'Orsay, Tour Eiffel and Château de Versailles. The staff were smart, professional, responsive and friendly. We were particularly impressed by Sheena. The very helpful advice that she gave to us on tourist attractions, travel, restaurants and shops was most welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Lawyer/Exporter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and very beautiful. The rooms are not large and the bed and doors squeak but the design is clever and the rooms enchanting. The position Is unbeatable, a few steps from the gare d'orsay Like all French hotels, breakfast is expensive but there is a great patisserie down the street and lots of coffee shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Dawn P
Reviews.Content: I had been really excited at the thoughts of staying here, seeing as the photos displayed on the hotel website looked amazing and we usually stay in ahem, very cheap n' cheerful places when we visit Paris. However, as this was a special occasion I put a lot more thought into choosing the hotel. Anyway, I will begin with the good points ; the location is excellent, you can walk to almost all of the main sites and my favourite shopping street (Rue St Honoré) is only a short walk across the river. The staff are very nice, especially the nice waitresses in the dining room. Now for the bad points ; the rooms are not in a great state of repair. We had booked through the small luxury hotel site and when I asked for a free upgrade (which you are entitled to where possible) I was told that they don't do that anymore. Ok, fair enough, We were then given the keys to our room and I have to say, I was so disappointed when I saw it that I almost burst into tears - the wallpaper was all marked and torn and reminicisent of wallpaper you would find in an 'old mans pub'. The room was very dark and only had tiny windows that wouldnt open and worst of all,. the coverlet on the bed was very badly stained. When I went down to complain, the girl at the desk looked pretty put out but I had my stern face on so she agreed to move our room. The next room we went to was in much better repair and much brighter too, so I was happier. However, we noticed that the wallpaper was peeling in this room too and that the coverlet was once again stained! After the drama we had with moving rooms the first time I was reluctant to go though the same process again so we just stayed put. Overall, I liked the location of the hotel and the friendly staff BUT I am afraid that I would not stay here again, due to the state of neglect the rooms I saw were in and seeing as the design of the rooms was the main reason that I wanted to stay in this hotel I was fairly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel steps from Musee D Orsay”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a last minute trip to Paris with a husband. We were only there 4 days and stayed at the hotel le Bellechasse for the entire stay. Our experience was wonderful. The hotel is located on a quiet street steps away Musee D Orsay. Location is convenient and fairly central. Very close to the Solferino metro stop and also a 15 min walk to the Invalides station. Staff is very friendly, speaks good English and eager to help with everything from dinner reservations to calling taxis to advice about places to eat, shop. Sheena at the front desk was wonderful and very very helpful. Rooms were small but comfortable. Good size for Europe. I personally loved the decor. We had the Privilege room which was cozy and stylish. The Wifi was a bit spotty. Overall the hotel was well worth the price for the service, location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, chic boutique BUT”
Reviews.Author: RonWamberal
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel I was looking forward to and really wanted to love. I had normally stayed on the other side of the river and this time I wanted location with life, shopping, galleries, restaurants, people, design etc. It had all of that but then it just missed out. Yes, like others say, it is design with Christian Lacroix' focus,it is chic boutique with cool decor, it is next to Musee d'Orsay, just a few minutes walk to Saint Germaine. We were going to L'atelier Joel Rubuchon for dinner and that was a bonus as it is just around the corner. But problems started from the first minutes. I wasn't aware that there were no parking facilities or help and we struggled with several suitcases on a very crowded narrow street. Eventually, as we got inside, a staff person asked "can I help" - it was a bit too late then. We had driven a fair distance from the south of France and I asked where the bathroom was and they pointed downstairs. Unfortunately, they didn't say that the stairs and dining room were in darkness and i struggled through a large dark room tripping over chairs and tables attempting to find a door to the bathroom. Then as we headed to our room on the sixth floor, the person advised that the lift was out of action to the sixth and that we had to do the last bit walking up stairs. The biggest shockthough was the size of the room - the web sites did not prepare you for the size of the room. I was aware that boutique European hotels can be small but I was still surprised. It was certainly an incentive to leave the room and enjoy the streets of Paris. My overwhelming feeling is that the staff in their black designer clothing are more comfortable dealing with clients of a similar age group.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly small room at premium price, not comfortable -- but great location”
Reviews.Author: HBMiller
Reviews.Content: We reserved a "privilege" room, the best in the house, on-line at the hotel's web site. The room does not include a separate bathroom -- the tub (no shower except handheld) and sink are in the bedroom. Maybe this is somebody's idea of a cute way to do things, but it is ridiculous. Total floor area is probably just over 100 square feet. Would never come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Little Gem with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ms321
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in a Privilege room. Room was ready when my wife arrived around 9:30 A.M. from her Transatlantic flight. The location cannot be beat. Room size was typical of European hotels, and beautifully decorated, and had a great bathroom. I didn't arrive until 1 A.M. the following morning and unfortunately my wife had taken a bad fall near the Louvre that evening, which required assistance at the first aid station in a shopping arcade near the Louve. After walking back to the hotel she spoke to the staff who were most helpful in keeping her supplied with icepacks.

Reviews.Title: “We accidentially stayed here and would definitely come back.”
Reviews.Author: charck
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at The Five Hotel and upon arrival we found that because of a booking conflict we were being moved to the Hotel Bellechasse. What at first was a hassle turned out to be fortuitous as the Bellechasse is a wonderful hotel (much better than currently higher ranked Five Hotel). The hotel is small and centered around a courtyard. Our room faced this courtyard and the glass door was the only window that allowed light in. We would have appreciated a bit more of a view, but when Paris is literally right at your doorstep (the location is excellent) It's not too much of a big deal. I did read a lot about the design of the rooms in the other reviews and ours was probably pretty tame, but definitely good looking. The steam shower was the most incredible shower I've ever experienced. I do believe each room has a different shower or tub setup so if one is important request a particular room in advance. The beds were comfortable and rooms were very quiet. The staff was very helpful, the breakfast excellent (much better than the Five Hotel's) and the room was of completely adequate size (at least double the size of the Five Hotel's room that we stayed in). After moving back to the Five Hotel we wanted to go back to the Bellechasse!

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique hotel making it a fun stay”
Reviews.Author: joannesim77
Reviews.Content: The cool decor made this boutique hotel an extremely memorable stay. The hotel is conveniently located at the Musee d'Orsay Metro. If you want to head downtown, it's a good 20 mins walk past down the Tuilleries Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Step one to a hipness upgrade...”
Reviews.Author: Keithcu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel le Bellechasse for three nights over my 8 year-old daughter's spring break. We loved the location, style, and beds. We needed two rooms and got Original and Privilege type rooms. Here's the difference. The Original was decorated with the butterfly motif. It has one double bed and a claw-foot bathtub/shower in the middle of the bedroom. It worked for my wife and me, but it affords very little privacy. The room is not what I'd call spacious, but it was plenty big for our tastes. It has nice door-style windows that we threw open for perfect sleep temperature (it was April, not August). The Privilege room was for my Mother and daughter. It officially has two single beds but the room is so small that the two beds touched, making it look like one. That freaked my daughter out a little and each night we'd have to rearrange the room a little to get some separation in the beds -- just to have the cleaning staff put them right back each day. The bathroom is much more traditional with a shower and a door. My Mom and daughter would have hated the Original room. Also, we did not pay full price -- we got a great deal using Jetsetter (a Gult.com travel site), and it worked out great.

Reviews.Title: “a treat”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: Le Bellechasse continues the association of fashion designers with hotel design, and to fabulous effect. This time the designer is Christian Lacroix, and the decor is a riotous mixture of trompe l’oeil, alice in wonderland, oversized insects, and architectural drawings combined with renaissance classics… and that is just scratching the surface. We stayed in one of the Original rooms, which was compact but cozy, and featured a standalone bathtub surrounded by curtains as well as the previously mentioned wall-coverings. The themes are continued in the basement restaurant – one of the more interesting spaces for breakfast in Paris. Bellechasse rates a Pink in the neilsonparc Lust LIst.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff. Rooms just okay.”
Reviews.Author: ScottnZelda
Reviews.Content: Located just behind the D'Orsay Museum with many neighborhood conveniences and metro stop (Solferino) close by. Wonderful front desk staff. We had one of the "privilege" rooms designed by Christian Lacroix, which was a bit over the top, but interesting. Too bad Mr. Lacroix didn't take "creature comfort" in to account, as the layout and fittings were odd. Space is okay if you don't have much luggage, or are staying a short time. Our stay was for 5 days and it felt cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: glamourgrl722
Reviews.Content: My mom and I loved this hotel. It's so chic (designed by Christian Lacroix!), and it's in a great location near the Musee d'Orsay and the Metro/RER. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VitalSpring
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Le Bellechasse, and here are my thoughts. 1) The room. The hotel is designed by Christian Lacroix, so the rooms are very striking. I loved the design: colorful, sophisticated, with a sense of humor. The room itself was beautiful. We stayed in one of the Discovery rooms, and it was actually much larger than I expected. The bed was extremely comfortable. This is not a cookie-cutter hotel room. I really felt like I got my money's worth here. 2) The staff. Probably the best part of the hotel experience is the staff. They were so friendly and helpful in every way. In fact, this was probably friendliest hotel staff I have ever experienced. We were greeted enthusiastically when we checked in, and whenever we needed reservations or directions, they were too happy to oblige. My special thanks to Constance, Sheena and Vincent. It was a pleasure to say bonjour to them every day, and they helped us in finding restaurants, going to tourist spots, getting to the airport, etc. Christelle was also helpful in getting us last minute dinner reservations. If you stay at Le Bellechasse, you know you will be well taken care of. These people are gems! 3) The location. Le Bellechasse is located in the Saint-Germain area, just steps from the Musee D'Orsay. I loved this neighborhood. It was quieter than the touristy areas around the Champs Elysees and the Louvre, yet within walking distance to the main attractions. There are also great restaurants and shops in the neighborhood. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel whole-heartedly to anyone, and I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “For those looking for something different!”
Reviews.Author: redrose046
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Bellechasse for a few nights in April. The hotel is in a fabulous location. It is just steps from the Musee D’Orsay as well as the Metro/RER train line and a short walk to the Louvre. It is also surrounded by quaint cafés and brasseries. The hotel staff and service is superb. All were very pleasant and helpful in every way. From the lighting to the wall design this is a very modern hotel. I stayed in a standard double bed room which was actually a nice size. The room was very clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. While there was a separate room for the toilet, the bath tub and sink are located in the hotel room itself. The bathtub had no shower head but a handheld one at the bottom of the tub. This made showering kind of a project. I would absolutely recommend this hotel 100% for those who are looking for something out of the box and are ok with trying something different!

Reviews.Title: “Location fantastic, hotel great”
Reviews.Author: Norvegienne
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, fantastic location, walking distance to it all. Small room but very nice, and comfortable bed. Highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way - location, rooms, staff”
Reviews.Author: DC_girlinLondon
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay here again. The hotel is about 50 yards/meters from the Musee d'orsay metro/RER stop, so a great location, and not far from the Boulevard Saint Germain, Eiffel Tower, etc. The rooms are very quiet, clean and comfortable, and more spacious than you typically get. A very modern design. The staff were also very helpful and put up with my 'franglais' mixture with a smile. The price is a bit high on the regular pricing, but if you can find a good deal (we did on jetsetter.com) it's worth the splurge. My only other (minor) complaint is that our bathroom only had a handheld unit. But other than that, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous treatment of guests (...and possibly illegal business practices)”
Reviews.Author: GWS1961
Reviews.Content: We had reserved and prepaid a superior room (double) at the Hotel Le Bellechasse and had subsequently decided to take our daughter with us for a couple of days in Paris. We had counted on the possibility to add an extra bed to the room but were in for a surprise when we arrived late in the evening. Karim, the night clerk refused in an arrogant way (even for Paris) and a highly inflexible, decidedly unhospitable attitude to accommodate our needs. He was backed by his supervisor, Nathalie. No extra bed, no permission for our daughter to spend the night in our bed. I have to say that I never felt as rejected and disrespected as a guest as in this hotel. Eventually they offered a larger room to accommodate the three of us in a 2 star hotel owned by the same company. This room was about 100 Euros cheaper than the room we had paid for. Obviously, no refund for the different quality of the proposed alternative was offered - which is possibly illegal. The next morning with the help of Expedia we managed to obtain a refund for two out of the three nights we paid for, but received no compensation for the price difference to the two star hotel we were put up at. While the interior of this hotel appeared unusual and quirky, the attitude of its staff towards their guests (with the notable exception of one young male attendant who showed a constructive attitude) – in my experience - is arrogant, inconsiderate and and derogatory.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful rooms, romantic”
Reviews.Author: Wildone186338
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 30 seconds walk from the Musee D'Orsay and the Metro station (just three stops from Gare du Nord). We never even used up our metro carnet as everything is within walking distance - including some amazing restaurants. There is also virtually no traffic and night noise. The rooms are compact but stunningly decorated and not too overwhelming. The sink and roll top bath are situated in the room. The bath was plenty big enough for two and meant we could listen to music, watch TV or chat without being in a separate room. There was also adequate cupboard space for a week. Best things - Fun vibe and location Worst thing - You pay for the location and best rooms

Reviews.Title: “Unique and chic”
Reviews.Author: ahorais
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location. All of the rooms are different and some can be kind of funky. For example, the toilet was in a small private room and the tub and sink were outside. No traditional shower, which forces you to take a bath (not that I mind). There wasn't a door from the room to the tub so make sure you either 1) go with someone you are completely comfortable with, or 2) make sure the room you get has a door. Good nights sleep and friendly staff. While extremely pricey, the breakfast is actually pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect, staff is attentive and room is very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RNVR
Reviews.Content: You leave the Musee dOrsay metro station and one of the first building is the hotel. Exterior is very unattractive, I believed it was under construction. But the interior is alluring, with beautiful furniture in a charming and chic atmosphere. Unfortunately I arrived at 11 am and the check in could be done only after 4 pm. This ultra late check in time will be considered next time I decide to stay or not in this hotel. But the receptionist kept my bags and at 4 pm when I returned from my parisian walking, they were in the room. By the way the room - named discovery - is clean and beautiful with lack of space, like other Paris hotels. But the decor - by Christian Lacroix - is very stylish, with big mirrors, strong and modern graphic wallpapers, carpets and curtains and and ultra soft and comfortable bed. The bathroom of my room was smaller than a wardrobe, and there was no space for towels or my necessaire, but the cosmetics were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Acemajorphi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a couples trip. Both couples stayed in the little courtyard which gave us great rooms, privacy and practically our own little courtyard. Book early and request one of these rooms, because some of the rooms are set up a little differently. The location is great, you can walk to several Metro or RER stops quickly and you are right at the Musee D'Orsay. I thought breakfast was expensive, but compared to cafes it was really a bargin. The staff all spoke English even when I tired to speak French (which was nice because my French is bad!) I recommend staying here if you like the left bank!

Reviews.Title: “Positives outweigh some (serious) flaws”
Reviews.Author: acontributor
Reviews.Content: First the postives:- 1. The location is fantastic. You are within walking distance of most major sites. The hotel is in a quiet location. 2. Online booking was excellent and communication with staff before and during the visit was friendly and efficient. 3. For the location, the hotel is reasonably priced although they should notify you in advance that breakfast isn't included. 4. It is clean and there is no noise from intrusive air-conditioning units. 5. The rooms are not as gaudy as the website could lead you to believe. Now the negatives:- 1. I don't have a problem with the size of the rooms but there is a distinct lack of wardrobe space. Our wardrobe was by the door and was in complete darkness. Seriously, we could have done with a torch to look for our belongings. I'm going to suggest to the hotel that they install lights in the wardrobe. 2. For a design hotel other features were unusual and distracting. I passed one (empty)room with its door open and I saw that it had its toilet was separate to the washing area and had no washbasin of its own! Our bathroom had an unusual design which wasn't entirely user friendly and would be too difficult to describe in this review. The tiling in the area of the washbasin was poorly finished and the outlet pipe leaked onto the clean towels beneath at some point. I got the impression that the interior design was done by someone more intent upon being interesting rather than having an eye on functionality. 3. We only had breakfast at the hotel on one day at €21 per head. For what it was, it was steep, but in view of the availability of produce and more than one hot drink it compared well to the cost of breakfasting elsewhere. More positively, the price of alcoholic drinks was not as eye watering as other hotels. I think someone booking this hotel who is aware of its flaws will probably find that their stay is enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tashb929
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Paris with my husband recently and stayed at Le Bellechasse. The room was extremely clean, and bigger than we were anticipating. The staff were very helpful. The location is fantastic, close to Musee D'Orsay, the Louvre and only about 20 minutes from the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to see Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Julie S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel le Bellechasse this past May on our second trip to Paris. We were anxious about our choice, as we had stayed in the Latin Quarter in 2009 and loved that location, but we were pleasantly surprised. Hotel le Bellechasse cost less than the Latin Quarter hotel, and was far nicer. You simply cannot beat the location--it is less than one block to the nearest Metro/RER station and the Musee d'Orsay. Many other popular sites and spots are in easy walking distance, such as Les Invalides (including Napoleon's Tomb). The rooms are very nice, if small, but that is typical of major cities. You could probably get a bigger room if you stayed further out from the center city, but why would you want to do that?? It was similar to a room in Manhattan. The room had a tiny "closet," which would be my only true complaint (it only had maybe 5 or 6 hangers, and between my husband's and my jackets, half of them were already used up before we put our clothes away!). The bath had the typical Parisian "shower," which is a hand-held sprayer in an open tub. It takes some getting used to, but I understand this is common. The toilet was in a separate space on the other side of the room. The bed was very comfortable, and our room was quiet, despite having windows facing the rue Bellechasse. The decor was...interesting, but only added to the charm, truly. The front desk staff were friendly, and very helpful with making restaurant recommendations and reservations, and for calling us a taxi when it was time to head to the train station. We would definitely come back. We found our room on Hotels.com for under 200 Euros/night, which is a total bargain for this location in the springtime! The breakfast was, as is often the case in Paris, overpriced and not really worth it. But it wasn't bad, and was okay if you were in a rush or didn't have the option of running out to one of the cafes in the area. We also appreciated the free Wifi offered at this hotel. We used it to check our email, etc. from my iPhone during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: AlexCorr
Reviews.Content: Small charming hotel with good location. Some rooms have the bath straight in the room. Nearby: good restaurant Ferme Saint-Simon with traditional cuisine

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: epaki
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had the pleasure of spending a weekend in Paris, and what a great way to introduce us to the city, but to stay at this little gem. Yes, there's no denying that the rooms are rather small, by western standards, however after staying at another hotel in the Latin Quarter the following weekend, this appears to be the norm. The rooms themselves were great - facilities were funky, with the individual room designs bordering on quirky. We didn't trial the in-house bar or the breakfast room, as we ventured out to eat and drink at the many local cafes and restaurants on St Germain Boulevard and many of the other side streets. As others have mentioned, the close proximity to St Germain, the Louvre, Seine and Musee d'Orsay is fantastic. If you are looking further afield (such as Versailles) then the two Metro stations within a couple of blocks can whiz you there hassle free for a measly EUR1.70 each. After venturing out to all of the main sights of Paris, do yourself a favour and take a walk through Montmartre up to Basilique du Sacré-Cœur before dusk. Aside from the magical basilique itself, the view over Paris from this high vantage point is fantastic. There's party atmosphere up there each night with many buskers and beer/water sellers there to keep you entertained and refreshed. What the sunset and hang-about to see the light show on the Eiffel Tower (the viewpoint for this is off to the side). There's also lots of quaint restaurants in the little village at the top where you can enjoy an evening of merriment, before trekking back down the hill to catch the Metro back to the hotel. To get there, take the Metro from Solferino (not Musee d'Orsay) - just head up the street from the Hotel to St Germain Boulevard, then its across the street (SGB) on the left. Take the train heading to Porte de la Chapelle and jump off at the Pigalle station. This puts on Boulevard de Clichy, a couple of blocks down from the famous Moulin Rouge. From there just start climbing the hills and follow the signs and people heading up to the Basilique (or you could always jump on the small bus ferrying people up and down). For your return journey, you will need to take the train from Pigalle heading to Maire d'lssy and jump off at Solferino.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy in a GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: travelingschmoopis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently concluded our stay at the Bellechasse. The location is second to none! 100 feet from the D'Orsay, a block from the seine and 2 blocks from St. Germain. There are a lot of little cafes and places to eat in the area and we especially loved Gosselin patisserie which is on the way to one of the train stations. The hotel is VERY close to two metro stations which made it very easy to get around. You are walking distance to both the San Germain shopping area and the louvre area. We actually found that we could walk to most places we wanted to see from the hotel but you are close to the metros if you need them. The service at the hotel was great and the front desk was very helpful in making all of our reservations including for nights where we needed suggestions. The rooms are very clean, the beds are comfy but the room is pretty small, even by European standards. The toilet closet was so very small it was difficult to close the door. Also, you shold be prepared that our room only had a hand held shower which had great water pressure especially when soaking the bathroom. Despite that however, we absolutely loved the location and would definitely come back to this hotel on future trips based on that alone. Some previous reviews said that rooms facing the street were loud. Our room faced the street and we had absolutely no problems with noise. Overall, we'd definitely recommend this place to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: fisherontour
Reviews.Content: Many of the delights of Paris are within a 20 minute walk. If you can't walk, then buses, taxis and Metro are very near by. As you would expect in Paris (unless you are prepared to pay a small fortune), the rooms are on the small side, but nonethelesss are very comfortable .Our friends had a problem with their shower and had to change rooms, which put a dampener on our stay. However this would not prevent me returning to this hotel. The breakfast was very good; quality of food was excellent. Service good. Pretty reasonable value for central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location. Great Price.”
Reviews.Author: cgcgcg19
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Bellechasse. It was a great boutique hotel in a fantastic location at a great price. Good breakfast, too. The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mr Lacroix, please design clothes, not hotel rooms !”
Reviews.Author: bestfreeway
Reviews.Content: When entering my room I felt so disappointed about the size, TINY, TINY, and even more by the decoration of Mr Lacroix, all is "Extravaganza" , you're not in a Parisian hotel room but in a kind of a bad "ole" "ole" Sevillan hotel. Now imagine your bath right in the middle of your room, with no possibility to have a proper shower and no privacy at all. My room was dark with no view at all. Now if I deveide the price I paid per the sqare meters I should have been in a 4* hotel. By the way this hotel has no stars registration...certainly because of the "no size" of the rooms. A shame cause the location is perfect !

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it ! but wonderfull location in the hart of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: rundj190454
Reviews.Content: I'm from Austria, not used to American bedroom size in Paris, But... My room was to tiny, 12 sq meters max.Unbeleivable for a 4* hotel! Have 2 suitcases with you and you cannot go around the bed. The hotel is VERY clean, TOP located, but add an extra 50 euros to your budget and you'll have a real 4* with a room bigger than the size of a wardrobe. The staff is perfectly parisian style, explaining you that your breakfast is an extra as welcoming words on arrival. Make sure when booking you don't have one of the room in the courtyard, I heard people complaining :No view, No light !, courtyard is the smoking area, very wet when rainning. Nice Atmophere anyway !

Reviews.Title: “so fashion !”
Reviews.Author: Hannah26Telaviv
Reviews.Content: I really liked the coulour of the room and the design touch of Christian Lacroix the french designer , I have booked this hostel because of some good reviews founded on internet and I didn't regret it at all !! The hostel is near Saint germain and it was very pleasant to walk around this area . the staff is very friendly and I absolutely loved my room (some drawings of butterflys ) . I recommend this hostel for lovers , my husband added a special lover package that was original and funny , I think this special extra is only available by booking it by phone , but I'm not sure .

Reviews.Title: “Location, design, comfort, staff: flawless for either business or leisure!”
Reviews.Author: d_isonthemove
Reviews.Content: IN-SHORT: it really was up to my expectations: perfect and quiet location, breath-taking yet very cosy design, great comfort and silent rooms, very nice staff. LOCATION: could not be any better, close to every place you might want to go when discovering Paris (1' from Musée d'Orsay and the river Seine, 3' from a subway station). The area is extremely quiet and one can easily find a café, restaurant or bakery near the hotel. ROOMS: the rooms are extremely well-thought and every inch is used in such a smart way that the rooms feel larger than they are (standard for a 4* in Paris). Ours (202) had a large bath and the bathroom was partitioned from the bed and desk area, sparing space while allowing some privacy. Very fluffy and comfortable bed. Very silent, you barely hear any noise from the hotel itself or the neighbourhood. DESIGN: the design alone makes it worth staying here! The rooms looks exactly like on their website pictures and are quite spectacularly designed, each in a different way with a different theme, by French fashion designer Christian Lacroix. I was fearing the lavish wallpapers and decoration might a bit over the top and even oppressive but it wasn't at all, just beautiful and of perfect taste, with various styles, colors and materials blending into each other. STAFF: exactly how i like it: very professional, helpful and friendly but discret. RECOMMENDED: for pretty much any occasion, leisure or business. I'll go back anytime, either for romantic trips, holidays with friends or alone. Booking in advance through their website gave me a very interesting discount. I did not try the BREAKFAST and therefore cannot recommend it (but Ladurée and Hermé are close and here's my hint for a great breakfast!).

Reviews.Title: “magnifique”
Reviews.Author: samoro57
Reviews.Content: a wonderful hotel in the heart of Paris; an outstanding team and service; a big thanks and Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Fashion, design and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Talia26
Reviews.Content: I love the work of the french designer Christian Lacroix, each room is different, full of warm colors, specially the red ones. The hotel is situated just near the Musee d'Orsay and few minutes walk from Saint Germain area. I can recommend it for business stay or for lovers, the staff is very helpfull and friendly for giving advices or nice places to visit in Paris. Try to take at least once, the breakfast, generous and full of organic products.

Reviews.Title: “Bizarre wallpapers, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: milena_dj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is being advertised as "entirely decorated by the famous designer Christian Lacroix"... except bizarre wallpapers I really don't know why this hotel would be named "chic and trendy". It's absolutely overpriced, with small rooms and cheep bathrooms. Except excellent location this hotel doesn't have anything to brag about. Reviews and photos online can be absolutely misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not much more. Oddball decor. Some staff unfriendly.”
Reviews.Author: happyinyournappy
Reviews.Content: We had great hopes for this stay having done loads of research online, but the photos were misguiding, we were quite taken aback by how small the top price room we had booked in fact turned out to be. And the butterflies and moths on the ceiling were actually a bit creepy. Things like door handles and fabrics were appealing . . . The two assets were the location (within a spit of the mused d'orsay and the seine) and the cleanliness. Staff was a bit aloof/odd. One chap knocked and entered our room (without us answering as we weren't sure it was a knock for us, it was do quiet) to check the minibar one afternoon! Another girl on reception offered to book a taxi for us to return to the station (gare du Nord) and I tried to refuse, saying I knew it would cost more than getting one from a rank, so was going to ask where the rank was. She said it wouldn't be much more, maybe three euros, so I was okay with that. What then happened was the taxi driver turned up, used the hotel loo, got us into taxi (meter running) and pulled off with the display already showing TEN euros! We weren't in a position yo quibble, but I was most annoyed at how wrong the receptionist was. We didn't eat here; instead I'd recommend a bigger better breakfast for half the price at Le Fregate a little further along the Seine travelling east. Eggs, bread, croissant and jam, juice and hot drink for 12 euros. It was not a negative experience thanks to the convenient location. We could walk anywhere and used the handy metro if we were tired/rained on, but I would look for better value next time.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Boutique Hotel steps from Musee D'Orsay”
Reviews.Author: Ouiparis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel le Bellechasse during the second half of my trip to Paris in October 2009. I absolutely loved being steps away from the D'Orsay and the Seine. The Christian Lacroix designs were probably too haute couture for my tastes but the bed was comfortable, sheets were luxe, and the room was spacious enough. Loved having a bath tub but one should note that the shower head is a hand held. I had breakfast twice and both times, I was the only one dining in the breakfast room. If you plan on visiting the D'Orsay (which you should), be sure to secure your ticket at the front desk. The hotel ticket allows you to skip the line.

Reviews.Title: “quite location, classy/small rooms, 3-4 star service a bit over priced”
Reviews.Author: luaidahlan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, but the service was not that good. We were on our honey moon and the rooms are small, bathroom (toilet seat area) is private and small, the shower/bath area has no door. The view is bad. It’s not my style, although my wife loved the room design since its by a high class designer, Christian Lacroix . No pay TV most channels are French. Front desk were friendly. What I like about it that it is far away from the crowded area (though they had construction going on :( ) And about 5-8 Euro away from all the attractions by cab! Couple of good bakeries around (just exist the hotel and keep going right pass the first intersection and it’s on your right at the corner of the 2nd intersection)

Reviews.Title: “Le Bellechasse a Lacroix Tale”
Reviews.Author: OzgurBaykut
Reviews.Content: A Design Hotel designed by Christian Laxroix is a few steps away from Musee d'Orsay. We have choosen Le Bellechasse from SLH list and had a look at the reviews at tripadvisor. We believe that it was a good choice. If you like St.Germain more than Concorde or other places Le Bellechasse is the best choice. Rooms were confortable and big enough. We stayed at the discovery room. Price was around 200EUR/night. For more information you can check hotels own web site www.lebellechasse.com and for Turkish review of the hotel you can check www.ozgurbaykut.com. I strongly recommend Le Bellechasse

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable, but little trace of luxury”
Reviews.Author: SM1998
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok, and an acceptable value (we paid about 199 euros per night), but I can’t say that I enjoyed it. Pro: well located, comfortable bed, friendly staff, clean. Con: appalling small rooms (yes, even by European standards), ceiling so low I could touch it when standing in my bare feet (I am 5’8”), terribly lit room, no full length mirror so I never knew how I looked, mediocre breakfast, not very luxurious even though it is part of the “Small Luxury Hotel” group. It’s not a bad value for what you get (it’s not that expensive by Paris standards), and it is a fine base for a trip in Paris. But if you want even a touch of luxury, this isn’t the place. And it’s definitely not the typical level of luxury for a Small Luxury Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “what a great place...”
Reviews.Author: adinutza_1975
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, professional staff, great location......will be back

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent honeymoon hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PinkiePorkchop
Reviews.Content: Could not have been more hip, stylish, fun, funky beautiful. Service was delightful, complementary drinks delivered to our door within 5 minutes of check-in. Beautiful decor by Christian LeCroix. Great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “nice and cozy”
Reviews.Author: 29marquise
Reviews.Content: Great hotel.Great for a city break,very romantic,nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: jbill123
Reviews.Content: Lots of charm, perfect location for the sights and Musee d'Orsay, and great service. Everyone was so friendly and we felt really welcome. Rooms are a good size too for Paris, and the decor is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “a gem”
Reviews.Author: DostiAli
Reviews.Content: if you can get over the rather small or as my wife described it 'cosy' room size you will enjoy your stay at la bellechasse. the room are beautifully designed and most importantly you get a comfy bed. it is true that although the tv has 200+ channels there are only 2-3 english ones(strange). If you ask at reception they are happy to borrow you a laptop for free with free wireless access. i have been to a few 5 star hotels over the globe and i must say that this beats most of those places hands down. some of the bedrooms have baths in the middle of the room, if you email ahead of your trip to the hotel and say what you require i am sure they can sort that out.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel of a find with a lot of class, style, and no frills. Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: CClaver
Reviews.Content: So before I booked the hotel I read all the reviews on Trip Advisor and basically the ones that were positive were pretty spot on. The location is very ideal. It's very central to getting to all the main sites. I wanted to stay in the St. Germain area with my wife who had never been to Paris before. This Hotel is on a tiny side street off Rue de St. Germain (Cab drivers may not know where it is exactly) and has a few cafes and souvenir places right there. From this location you are 100 steps from the Museum Orsay, across the river from the Louvre, in the heart of St. Germain with it's great restaurants and cafes, Luxembourg Garden and healthy walks to the Eiffel Tower, Champ Elysee and Notre Dame. The RER C line is also right there which can take you to the airport (transfer to the B line) for about 9 Euros per person or down to a visit to Versailles for about the same price. You also are near the Metro line 12 near the Solferino stop which easily connects to various lines that will take you all over Paris. We found taking the trains very easy to use for the most part (except going to the airport on RER B, our tickets were not valid at the exit lane and we still don't know why even though we got them from a ticket agent and said we were going to CDG and paid 17 Euros for both of us). The trains look intimidating at first, but are really simple with a good map. On the hotel. We skipped the 21 Euros per person buffet although it looked nice. If you want a big breakfast with multiple items then this is probably a good deal. Otherwise, you can get a small breakfast with a pastry or crepes and beverage for about 10-12 Euros in most cafes or go down the street and buy it from the corner bakery which is what most of the locals seem to do. The room is small and I had no trouble connecting up to the Internet or having hot water during our stay so the one persons review (in September 09) here obviously had a bad bit of luck. As everyone else has stated the decorations are really unique and the bathtub in the room is certainly different but hey, this was a place to sleep and shower and get going each day. The bed was very comfortable, towels were fluffy, bath robes are provided and we heard no street noise in the evening. There is a mini bar in the room and the flat panel TV gets all sorts of channels but only a few in English (but we were not there to watch TV). If you want a full service hotel then this is not the place to be. But my wife and I spent so little time in our room that this was really perfect for us. A family may feel cramped in these rooms. But we are kind of easy going and I don't need the frills of an expensive hotel that will cost 3x as much or more. We were gone by 8:30 each day and returned around 11:00 for the most part each evening. My only minor comment was the front service which was okay. Not great, but not bad either. A friend left a phone message for me which never got delivered until a day later when I needed to get a new key card after we decided to stay 1 extra night instead of going to London. Even though the room has a phone with a message waiting light on it or they could have slipped it under my door. Luckily the friend reached me via cell phone. Also, when I asked to stay an extra night, they would not give me the same rate I had previously booked that week through an on-line service. It cost me about 100 euros more for the one extra night but we were having such a good time and I didn't want to start packing up to go to another place that I just accepted it reluctantly. I would go back but I am also the type to look for new places to stay and experience. But I wouldn't hesitate recommending this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was everythinig we wanted and more!”
Reviews.Author: wanderinggypsy052
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and the service was excellent. The staff were always helpful and pleasant. They booked tours for us, suggested places to eat and to shop, and guided us with great directions for the Metro. I read the 2 previous reviews and cannot understand how negative they are. It is as though the reviewers stayed at a different hotel. We did not experience the water shut down and had plenty of hot water whenever we wanted it. The rooms were lovely and, yes, small by North American standards but terrific nonetheless. We stayed 8 nights at Bellechasse and each one was great. The restaurant is breakfast only but they also have room service (cold meals) if you would like to eat in your room. This hotel is well situated in an very good neighbourhood and is very well priced. We would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay here”
Reviews.Author: purpleowl9857
Reviews.Content: Do you like taking cold showers after waiting two hours for your room? Then you'll really love the bathtub in the middle of the room, perfect for families or brand new aquaintances. If you're not claustrophobic and tripping on acid, then this hotel is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “This place is horrible...the worst”
Reviews.Author: glacierfjord
Reviews.Content: I got to the hotel a little early, and the room wasn't ready. That's fine; I was early, so I spent awhile walking around until it was ready. When I got up to the room, the endless stream of mistakes/annoyances happened. First, someone else's luggage was brought up: not that big a deal. Then, there was no wireless as promised: a bigger deal, since I'm here for work and pleasure. Then, there was no water! A very big deal. I talked to the receptionist (and they knew me well from trying to figure out why there was no internet in the room) and they told me the hot water had gone off the night before and now there was no water for the forseeable future. I told them I was leaving to stay at another hotel, and they told me I would have to pay for the night because I didn't cancel 72 hours in advance! There was no water in the hotel! I asked to talk to a manager and they told me they didn't know when the manager would be in. Probably not that day. I could write the manager a letter if I wanted to. They were incredible rude and not helpful. In addition, fixtures were loose and the room was generally on the shoddy side. Most importantly, there was no water, and no apology for no water!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Pad”
Reviews.Author: foodieheaven
Reviews.Content: The decoration of Le Bellechasse has been done with such style and finesse - Lacroix has created the feeling of being in a theatre...and a very, very comfortable one! The location is perfect - next to the D'Orsay, and the hotel will sell you prebooked tickets to avoid any queues. After reading reviews mentioning tiny rooms, we were pleasantly surprised - the rooms were compact, but only what one would expect in a city...and certainly hadn't expected a little terrace which led back down to the little hotel bar! I am very pickky, but this hotel was superb - it's only hitch being the lack of restaurant and the slightly gloomy basement (for breakfast for which they charge extra) - no matter -with the superb bistro a few doors down Rue Bellechasse (No 20) where we had a fantastically relaxed and friendly evening with great food and wine. The rooms were so quiet, and the beds were very comfortable - we had a very good night's sleep. We were recommended to go to Le Pain Quotidian for breakfast by the staff at no 20 - a perfect suggestion - the breakfast was very good and very large! The building a beautiful old bakehouse with exposed limestone walls, scrubbed pine tables and antique mirrors completing the faded grandeur look, only possible in Paris. We plan to go back to Bellechasse and No 20 again...although the same can't be said of the open topped tour buses - so expensive - walk and use the money instead to lunch somewhere fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Design Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryzee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bellechasse for 3 nights before embarking on at 3 week road trip around France. We knew from Tripadvisor that the rooms would be small and a little different and they certainly were. We were in the Butterfly room which had both the bathtub and sink right in the bedroom, the only separate space was for the toilet. In the ideal world I would have preferred a separate full bathroom but the rate for this place was quite reasonable for Paris so all was okay. We had breakfast at the hotel only on one morning. There is nothing I love more than an overpriced hotel breakfast, newspaper, fresh coffee, eggs, toast, etc unfortunately the breakfast here was very poor, ice cold eggs and weiners in the buffet and minimal selection of other items. I can't understand how a very small hotel like this can justify a buffet, we were the only ones in the breakfast room, there must be so much waste. The hotel is in a superb location and very easy to walk everywhere. This was our 5th visit to Paris and the first time we never used the Metro, we just walked everywhere. Some walks were a little long (20-30 min to Eiffel Tower, 30 min to Le Marais) but Paris is such a beautiful city to walk.

Reviews.Title: “great location can walk EVERYWHERE”
Reviews.Author: anilegna
Reviews.Content: picked this hotel mainly coz I liked the location, smack in the middle of Paris and could walk everywhere (well almost everywhere) the room was beautiful and the breakfast a decent value for 22 euro (coffee everywhere else cost 5-6 euro already so could be cheaper to eat here) in a quiet part of town where you can walk off to buy groceries as well in one of the local delis, 3 min away from restaurants like Gaya (Pierre's) and robouchon, a slightly longer walk to il vino (and many other excellent restaurants), next door to musee d'orsay, across the river from the louvre, nice arts galleries and a couple of cute boutique in the area. Rooms also had free wi-fi and were nice and quiet. I most likely will come back and stay here again reason why this is a 4 and not a 5 1) small rooms 2) the purple glass separating the bathroom was not that clean.... 3) I stayed in room 602, the walls must have been very thin coz I heard everything in 601, ie opening of bathroom / closet door, when someone knocked on the door of 601 it sounded like they knocked on my door.... still, a nice stay

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sma912
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay here last Christmas and felt compelled to write a review given the lasting impression it made on me. The rooms are lovely, impeccably clean and beautifully designed. The hotel is truly unique and is in a wonderful location, just moments from the Musee d'Orsay yet very quiet and perfect for a relaxing night's sleep. Lots of great shops and restaurants just moments away too. Service was also fantastic, and for the price I couldn't ask for more. Stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location :) Small room :(”
Reviews.Author: jrp9f
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a wonderful three night stay at the Hotel Bellechasse. It was my husband's first trip to Paris so I wanted a hotel with a central location that wasn't too expensive (our rate was €250/nt) but had a fun Parisian feel and that is certainly what we got and in a good way! There are so many great things about the Bellchasse 1) the location is really great - a stone's throw away from the Musee d'Orsay (fyi, you can buy tickets from the hotel and then go to the advance reservation ticket door D and skip the long queues), right across the river from the Louvre (easy 10min walk) and right inbetween two metro stops for different lines. 2) the service was very helpful before and during our trip - the front desk helped with restaurant reservations, taxis, etc and happily so. 3) our room was beautiful (we were in one with a giant blue sun on the wall) and really very comfortable. The bed was heavenly - so much so that we had a hard time getting up some mornings! The only drawback to our stay was that like other reviewers say, the rooms are very small (bathrooms too - there's no door to the bathroom, fyi, so probably not a good place to stay unless it's with someone you're very close to and also just a handheld shower). This coming from someone who has lived in NYC and London for 10 years. But thankfully, after reading previous reviews, we were prepared for how small the room was going to be so we weren't surprised. So if you want a big room, don't stay here. But we didn't really mind as we didn't spend a whole lot of time in it! This aside, I'm pretty sure that we'd stay here again when we come back to Paris which we will hopefully be able to do soon! (Oh, they also have free wifi, nice)

Reviews.Title: “Yes, this place has personality”
Reviews.Author: mrvinotinto
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia, which gave the best rate that I could find after shopping around. The location of this hotel is not even half a block away from the Musee d'Orsay, very close to Blvd St Germain and the Seine. Good location for a first or second-time visitor. You're just a few minutes from all the major museums, attractions. Subway, RER, and bus connections are easy from the hotel. The location is very quiet, the 7th is a residential neighborhood, and it was nice to step away from the hordes of tourists (particularly the EU student groups) that take over some parts of the city. I don't recommend the 5th unless you want to be surrounded by 16-year olds with their school groups all the time. The downside to the quiet neighborhood is that the immediate vicinity is not exactly a nightlife hotspot and there aren't any great bistros within a 5-minute walk (although you'll find many great options if you're willing to walk 15 minutes). The people at the front desk were very nice, with no weird attitudes or vibes. Small requests were addressed with a smile (for example, asking if they could call a resturant on my behalf to make a reservation). Our room was very hip and stylishly decorated, with nice a combination of fabrics, textures, colors, and motifs. We were booked into the "Discovery Room," probably named such because you will certainly discover very ,very well your travelling companion in the small space. There's only a couple of feet around the bed, and in that space they manage to squeeze a desk (with an ottoman - no real chair), another ottoman and a minibar. We placed one of our carry ons on top of the ottoman, and the other under the bed. Good thing we didn't bring a suitcase-not sure where we would have put that. To wash your hands after going to the potty required going around or going on top of the bed, because there isn't enough room to put a connection between the potty and the sink/bathtub. It sounds like I am complaining, but the small room size did not bother us. We slept great, thanks to a good bed, good sheets, and no noise (and our room faced the street!). Big windows and french balconies completed the room, which was indeed interesting and different. The free wifi was great for staying in touch with home and checking out resturants and shops. FYI, the breakfast (buffet) was 21 euros, but we opted for the cafe right outside the hotel in front of d'Orsay. There's a plasma and they must have the largest news channel package I have ever seen. Whether it was Albanian or Armenian or Aragonian news, they had it. They also had a couple of English-language channels (I think CNN and BBC). Not that you'll be watching any news while in Paris... Yes, this place has personality. If you want to avoid a bland hotel and do want a central, quiet location, this would be an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel in a GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: amrtravel
Reviews.Content: A wonderful boutique hotel on the Left Bank – just off St. Germain. The location is amazing…in walking distance to wonderful shops, cafes (i.e. Café de Flore, Les Deaux Magots, Café Lipp and many more). You can walk everywhere and if your destination is too far the Metro is a mere 2 blocks away! Beware - the rooms are small (what isn’t in Europe?) but wonderful amenities and very quiet. Who has time to stay in the room anyway? The staff is extremely friendly and willing to help! Would recommend this to any hip travelers…not good for kids

Reviews.Title: “Drama, comfort and class”
Reviews.Author: redsandyboy
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a beautiful hotel this is. No attention to detail has been spared in its decor, the staff are professional and friendly and the whole place exudes class and style. We were in a 'discovery room' decked out with flock wallpaper, beautiful yellow drapes and lovely large bath. Even though the decor was dramatic, the room was very easy to relax in and had all the mod cons needed to do so. The room came with a flat screen tv, ipod dock, safe, minibar and fluffy bathrobes. All in all a prefect romantic weekend hotel. It's in a great part of town - right behind the Musee D'Orsay (and its railway station) and surrounded by many great restaurants and pattiseries.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely for a romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: thalgizouzle
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good - literally at the Musee d'Orsay and thus easy walking to the big attractions (Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Notre Dame, Opera, Invalides, etc etc). It is also in a charming, very quiet neighbourhood that you will enjoy walking around (and shopping in). The desk staff were very helpful, efficient and friendly. The decor is really lovely - so colourful and imaginative. Same goes for the room - we had the butterflies room which was as lovely as on the website. However, this room would have been a disaster were we not a couple, as it is very small, and the bathtub/shower is literally in the middle of it - with only the curtain to give privacy. The room was definitely a victim of visual design over function, and had we stayed more than two nights, I would have been thoroughly annoyed. At two nights, however, it was charming and quirky and fun. Similarly, the common areas are very small and would not be great for an extended trip. I am very pleased to have had our weekend there, but this would not be my choice again in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish, but v small rooms”
Reviews.Author: timffm
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, on a romanitc break. We arrived early but the very friendly receptionist checked us in and took us to our room to show us how it worked. You are paying for the style in this hotel, the amenities are pretty basic, but fine for a tourist hotel. Rooms small (aren't they all in Paris), and location great - its 20 metres from the RER and Musee D'Orsay Recommended for a romantic break

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of the trip!”
Reviews.Author: Paula087
Reviews.Content: After spending a month in France and seeing alot of different hotels, this one is by far the best hotel of the trip. Rooms are unique and although not spacious for American standards it was spacious for European standards. The staff was extremely helpful and I even got ice every night. Which in Europe is a treat! I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Wonder2006
Reviews.Content: Agree with others that the rooms are on the small side, but we absolutely loved it! Room was absolutely gorgeous, very clean, staff were friendly. We got a special deal through a Eurostar package, and you are never sure whether you're going to be treated as second rate having not paid the full tarif, but we had a lovely stay. Location is good, and it's quiet - didn't hear any other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: moggybelle
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with very welcoming staff. It is in a great location tucked behind the Musee D'Orsay but once you are inside it is quite peaceful. The decor of the rooms is fabulous, with interesting prints even covering the ceiling. The rooms come equipped with televisions and ipod docks.
