All the rooms have free standing baths making the rooms luxurious and romantic in a way. We were welcomed with a delicious welcome cocktail brought to our room and a small box of macaroons. The perfect base to explore Paris and the nicest and chicest hotel I've stayed in there!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, style and location”
Reviews.Author: borg321
Reviews.Content: I am just back from spending the weekend with my fiance at le Bellechasse in Paris. Le Bellechasse offers three things that I highly value while staying at a hotel. Location - The hotel is located in a small street just one block from Musse d'Orsay and the Seine. This means a quiet location while still being in a perfect location both for daily and nightly adventures. Shopping, restaurants and culture is a short walk away. Service - At Le Bellechasse, service is offered with a perfect mix of sincerity and professionalism. This is service at its best to me, people being friendly and relaxed while offering professional service. Style - The interiors of this hotel is simply spectacular and very inspiring. I spent a good 20 minutes when walking into our room only looking a the different materials and the ingenuity which they had been combined. This is without a doubt a great and original hotel that I recommend you to stay at while in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler1500
Reviews.Content: I know Paris well. For the past several years I had stayed in a hotel I'd loved but the service started to go downhill (reviewed well on this site, but the review is no longer valid - so if you're looking for Paris hotels, avoid the Artus) - so I looked for somewhere new and found the Bellechasse. Had a pleasant stay with a couple of little hiccups, which were just about the room. The location is great -- touristy street, but a block from the Seine (not to mention the Musee d'Orsay) in central Paris is just about perfect. Service is marvelous - really terrific ... and the main reason I probably will go back. The downside is that the rooms are just okay. Decent bedding and towels, good size safe, very nice bath, and decent closet space (for one person, anyway). I love Lacroix and his design was one of the main reasons I chose this hotel - but the decor just felt off and not quite comfortable - (I liked the giant dragonflies and fashiony murals - but what was with the stuffy grandma draperies in the same room?) The oddest thing, though, is that for a hotel that calls itself a fashion hotel ... there is no full length mirror anywhere in the room and barely enough light in the bath (which has the best light in the room) to put on makeup (though, the bath lighting is something the hotel staff said is being worked on and should be improved soon.) Service is very important to me, and the truth is that TRULY gracious service is not easy to come by in the small 3 and 4 stars in Paris - and it's here in every last staff member (for both English and French speaking guests). So, I probably will give it another try (and perhaps just request a different room).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ever !”
Reviews.Author: Mats_Stockholm
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels all ower the world and hotel le Bellechasse is on our top 3 ! The hotel is a dream. We got a wounderful welcome when we arrived. One of the receptionist followed us to our room and gave us very personal introduction to our room. She explained everything about the room and also the designers tauthes about the roomdesign. After only a coupple of minutes our luggage was carried to our room. We were so happy to get one of the butterflyes-rooms (in the colour of blue). Our room wasn´t small at all and the designt was stunning. Every detail of the room was so perfect, from furniuris to coloures and lightning. Cosy bathrobes and slippers. And the room was so quiet, you didn´t hear any sound from outside, neither from the room next to yours. Alltrough our staying the staff were so friendly and helpfull. It´s so nice to stay in such a small hotel in a big city, it´s gets it moore personal. And everytime passing the reception you get a nice smile and a warm greeting. When it was time to check out we both didn´t want to leave, we just wanted to stay. The only problem is if we are going to visit Paris again we can´t think of staying at any other hotel than the le Bellchasse ! This is a magnifiscant hotel that will make your Paris visit to something speciell !!

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed”
Reviews.Author: BerkeleyE
Reviews.Content: Not a massive fan – heard about it in conde naste and booked is for the last two nights of my honeymoon. The rooms were tiny and felt quite cheap – both taps came off in my hand when I tried to use them and the bin broke as well. The decoration was extraordinary – not as cool as the website made it look – to be honest just garish. Maybe I’m not cool enough to appreciate it. The location was amazing however. Would not recommend as a cool boutique hotel – more like a tarted up travellodge.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room”
Reviews.Author: thansj
Reviews.Content: Loved the room. And soo nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, convenient, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dman7878
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for a short stay (2-4 nights). Great spot, great value for money, very stylish. Advice: If you ring them they will give you the room you want, some are a little 'too' stylish than others. The one with the pink stripes at the front of the building was excellent. Downfall: Room was a tad small, but made up for it in covenience and charm. I wouldn't let that put you off for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: hankijune
Reviews.Content: As frequent travelers we often end up staying in properties with consistent quality standards, such as Westin, Fairmont, Ritz etc... But given we were on our honeymoon we wanted to try something truly special in Paris, something different from the standard 4 or 5 star chain hotels that dominate the globe. That lead us to Hotel Bellechasse which we choose based on 2 factors, the solid reviews on trip advisor and the wonder pictures of the rooms on the hotel website. What you see is what you get, simply fantastic. Service with a smile and eager to help and please. The first am we woke up a 5:00 am and there was nothing open when we went outside at 6:00 am. We returned and frontdesk offered to get us coffee ASAP, must have seen how tired we were. I could go on, but if you in Paris for romance you will never regret choosing this hotel, the beauty of the hotel and the rooms is something you will be hard pressed to find anywhere else. In fact my wife is ready to leave Paris after 4 nights, but not ready to leave the Hotel! And I am writing this review on my final night in the hotel room, on FREE WIFI!! Thanks to all the staff at the hotel who made our stay a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, decent staff”
Reviews.Author: Visionaire
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful boutique hotel with a decent staff. The location of this hotel is ideal for people seeking a true Parisian feel of local life. It's situated right by the beautiful Seine River and the Musee d'Orsay. It's surrounded by magical little streets and charming antique shops. The neighborhood is so chic and calm. I arrived at the hotel and didn't expect any welcoming smiles or smirks. I definitely didn't get any either! Since I was in Paris on mostly business, It was such a relief to know that this hotel offered free wiFi. (I really didn't feel like going out and searching for a hot spot.) The hotel's wiFi wasn't working on the day I arrived. The staff was very nonchalant about the situation. It was the weekend and I assume there was nothing they could really do. I was assured by the desk clerk that internet service would be up and running in the morning. By the next afternoon, the wiFi still wasn't working. The staff didn't bother to call anyone to have it fixed. Well, I still enjoyed my short stay at this hotel despite some inconvenience and lack of service. The comfort and decor made up for it all.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: organised1
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through the hotels website and found it to be a fantastic place we would definitely go back to again. The room was immaculately clean, well decorated as you would expect and comfortable in size for the both of us. TV provided lots of light entertainment in the evenings, as we surfed through lots of hd satellite channels. A reviewer had said its ten minutes from the Orsay, we have no idea what they are talking about. its literally seconds away not minutes. 8-10 mins from the louvre and a 30 - 40 min walk to the eiffel tower,dont walk, get a taxi! (they are reasonably priced) Taxi from the hotel to the pompidou centere was only 5 euros. Eateries are kinda expensive in the area, but its generally expected as you will be very central. The room service was reasonable, considering we did order at a really late hour when everything else was closed, and we had free internet the whole time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for Paris”
Reviews.Author: PlusChild
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of the hotel. Rooms were good for a Paris hotel. Staff were ok, not as friendly as other reviewers have commented on. Overall, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Style over Substance?”
Reviews.Author: LondonAnt
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location - one minute from Musee D'Orsay and a short walk from lots of interesting areas. Staff are very helpful and the hotel is immaculately clean. Our room was a fair size, although the bathroom is sort of within the room which takes up quite a bit of space. We had a huge bath which leaked, but they sorted this out quite promptly. Other than the room, there really aren't any hotel amenities on offer - the breakfast is a big rip off - 20 plus euros and no fruit - just rather dried up scrambled egg and croissants. Better off strolling over to the Cafe Marly at the Louvre or any of the nearby cafes. There is a small bar area, but drinks are v. expensive and the lighting is rather severe. Style is fun, but quite cheaply done - Lacroix done on a Changing Rooms budget. We booked via Eurostar - whilst this didn't come up as an option on their site, I think they have a deal with Expedia, so called them and managed to get a good package deal.

Reviews.Title: “all round excellent!”
Reviews.Author: sandrajapan
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel from a selection offered with the EuroStar package and couldn't believe our luck. Perfect location, excellent service and accomadation. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Extraudanary rooms”
Reviews.Author: gzapata
Reviews.Content: My neighbor recommended this hotel to us and I am very happy that I took his advise. My wife and I could not believe the beautiful paintings the rooms had, They were very nice to show us 2 different rooms and each was totally different. The room had LCD TV and we had WIFI to be able to email to our friends. I recommend any body going to Paris to stay at this hotel, It is different from any hotel I stayed. The ambient was very friendly , and very close to museum d’Orsay in the heart of Saint Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Wow Wow”
Reviews.Author: SergeParis001
Reviews.Content: i went to this hotel as I like a lot christian lacroix touch, and the hotel is pretty big for a parisian hotel, the recepetion, the breakfast rrom are pretty big and very well decorated. the rooms are a amazing, it is very mode. the room are not very big, but this usual in paris, and actually they are bigger to what im used to. the staff is pleasant and very helpfull and the location is the best, 10 meters aay from the musee d orsay in teh heat of st geermain. the price is high, but worth it !
